capital/theater/engineer.accept-find-crystal: I'll see what I can do.
capital/theater/engineer.ask-about-celeestial-device-parts: Did you finish working on those Celestial Device parts ?
capital/theater/engineer.ask-about-celestial-device: I need to build a Celestial Device. You think you could help me ? [Show him the blueprints]
capital/theater/engineer.ask-about-generator: What's that thing you're working on ?
capital/theater/engineer.ask-crystal-replacement: Can't you replace the crystal with something else ?
capital/theater/engineer.ask-crystal-whereabout-more: There has to be another way.
capital/theater/engineer.ask-crystal-whereabouts: Any idea where to find another one ?
capital/theater/engineer.ask-make-celestial-device-parts: Alright. Can you make those parts for me then ?
capital/theater/engineer.ask-suggestion-celestial-device-arm: Is there any place you know where I might find an Atmospheric Regulation Module, then ?
capital/theater/engineer.ask-to-learn: I'd like to learn mechanics. Will you let me work with you for a day ?
capital/theater/engineer.boast-about-already-having-arm: Don't worry about the Atmospheric Regulation Module. I already picked it up.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/accept-craft-parts: Give me a week and I'll prepare everything I can make here.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/arm-already-found:
Well I'll be damned. You are really good at getting your hooves on stuff, aren't you ?

Good lad.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/arm-location-suggestion:
You might find it in another Vault... this part was also used as an atmosphere purifier in some underground complexes, where they conducted experiments that could corrupt the atmosphere.

And speaking of ruins... they're all around us! You could try the Umbridge Lab. It's not far, north of the theater. I wouldn't be surprised if there were some technological treasures there. It might be the module you're looking for... but it's crawling with mutant crap over there.

If you're crazy enough to go there, talk to Whispering Ash. He might be able to help you.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/give-parts:
Yeah, yeah, here it is. Take your damned parts.

He shows you a set of finely crafted pieces, which he obviously took great care into meticulously preparing for you.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/introduction:
{{npc}} grabs the plans, unrolling them on his workbench. His gaze narrows as he analyzes the schematics, occasionally letting out a grunt.

Hm. That's good stuff... arcane stabilizer, redundant power supply... and those circuits... who designed something like that?

I have no fucking idea what it's supposed to do... but... yeah. I can cobble together some of the parts for you.

But there's one problem: that part... the Atmospheric Regulation Module... I can't replicate its magical matrix, and some parts can only be made using specialized machines. If you want an Atmospheric Regulation Module, you'll have to find it yourself.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/negociate-craft-part-ba: I guess I can make a gesture... I'll do it for {{celestialDevicePartsPrice}} caps. But I'm barely making any margin here, so don't ask for any less.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/negociate-craft-parts: Well, it won't be easy, and I'll have to use some of my parts. I'll do it. For a price. {{celestialDevicePartsPrice}} caps. Payed up front.
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/negociate-crat-parts-ba: Who do you take me for ? I'm not a merchant, I'm a mechanic, a craftspony. Don't you value my work at all ?
capital/theater/engineer.celestial-device/parts-not-ready:
Kids these days… not a bit of patience.

Do you think I can craft these parts just by clapping a hoof ? Come back later. I'll tell you when it's ready.
capital/theater/engineer.crystal-prompt-leave: I just wanted to see if you were doing okay.
capital/theater/engineer.crystal-prompt-not-yet: Not yet, but I'm working on it !
capital/theater/engineer.crystal-prompt-success: I'm afraid you were wrong. I have an electromagic spinel, right here.
capital/theater/engineer.crystal/found-crystal:
Shiiiit… you really did find it ?

He delicately picks up the purple, gold-striked stone. It radiates a faint pulse of light.

Where could you possibly have… ? Well, you know what, I don't wanna know. If you had to to pick that up on a steaming pile of bodies, I don't wanna know.
capital/theater/engineer.crystal/prompt: Hey, you're back. So, did you find that darned electromagic spinel, or did you come back to admit that I told you so ?
capital/theater/engineer.crystal/replace-crystal:
Rotten Gear inserts the crystal into the reactor. A moment of silence… then a burst of energy courses through the patched-up cables. The lights of Ashaven gain in intensity, and the generator's vibration becomes more stable.

Rotten Gear pats the machine, satisfied, then turns to you.

Damn, it works. We may have bought ourselves a few more decades.

You don't look like much, but you're actually a fucking hero.
capital/theater/engineer.crystal/reward:
Rotten Gear sighs and pulls out a small pouch, tossing it to you.

Yeah, yeah. Here are your {{crystalReward}} caps. That's all we can afford around here.

Even though, just between you and me… that damn crystal was worth a hundred times more.
capital/theater/engineer.crystal/thanks:
Yeah… ponies like you are uncommon.

Listen, I'm not one for emotional things, but… I'll pay you back. One way or another.
capital/theater/engineer.entry:
You again ? I was hoping maybe somepony else would come bother me, for once !

So, what do you want ?
capital/theater/engineer.entry-leave: I just came to see if your bad mood finally wore off. Guess I'll come back later.
capital/theater/engineer.found-crystal-brag: You're right, you probably don't want to know.
capital/theater/engineer.generator-offer-help: Do you care for some help ?
capital/theater/engineer.help-already-has-cristal: Sneakily pick up the spinel and pretend you found something behind his hear: Abracadabra.
capital/theater/engineer.intro/about-generator:
That, that's the only reason Ashaven still holds together.

An old generator I fixed up from a pre-war crystalline reactor. It's been running for decades… until that darned crystal started to crack.

Without the crystal, we're doomed. The lights will go out. The heating as well. And this spot will become just as much as a ruin as anything else around.
capital/theater/engineer.intro/alt: Yes, what is it this time ?
capital/theater/engineer.intro/crystal-whereabouts:
Well, you can try to steal one from the Steel Rangers. Good luck not ending up in a pile of ash.

These dumbasses keep some in their bunker. But considering their appreciation for strangers, I doubt they'd even let you through the front door.
capital/theater/engineer.intro/engineer: You got a good eye. Yeah, it's a whole bunch of pre-war components put together, and a sucked up crystal... but it's what makes light at night and warms up our flanks.
capital/theater/engineer.intro/help-offered:
Really ? Are you an engineer now ?

Well… I don't see how it could get worse anyway.

Listen, if by some sort of miracle, you end up walking on a fresh Electromagic Spinel… then maybe I can save that generator. But it's not like that stuff grows on trees, so unless you're a fucking magician, I don't see how you're gonna do it.
capital/theater/engineer.introduction:
You see a ghoul getting busy fixing up a generator. When he sees you, he startles, hit his head on a shelf. A whole toolbox falls and spills on the floor.

OUCH ! That shouldn't even have been there !

You better have a damn good reason to be here. I'm BUSY. What do you want ?
capital/theater/engineer.introduction-engineer: Good stuff, that generator. How do you manage to keep the load balanced with all that patchwork ?
capital/theater/engineer.negociate-celestial-device-price: That's a bit too expensive. Can you make me a lower offer ? It'd be a waste to miss such a work opportunity, don't you think ?
capital/theater/engineer.negociate-craft-parts-reject: I can't pay that much. Another time, maybe.
capital/theater/engineer.repair-has-no-skills: I want to learn. You never know when it's gonna be useful.
capital/theater/engineer.repair-has-skills: I already know some stuff. I could be helpful.
capital/theater/engineer.repair/entry:
You ? Learning mechanics ?

I'm not exactly the teaching kind, you know.
capital/theater/engineer.repair/reject-help:
Listen, kid, I don't have time to explain to a novice how not to set fire to a generator.

If you ever learn to hold an adjustable wrench without needing an instruction manual, we'll talk about it again.
capital/theater/engineer.repair/start-repair: Well, you seem to know the difference between a screwdriver and a toothpick. I'm going to have you try fixing one of these water pumps.
